posts._title: Xavier Beauvois – Le Petit Lieutenant AKA The Young Lieutenant (2005)
posts.title: Le Petit Lieutenant
posts.excerpt: A rookie policeman from provincial Le Havre volunteers for the high pressure Parisian homicide bureau and is assigned to a middle-aged woman detective.

posts._title: Ngozi Onwurah – Welcome II the Terrordome (1995)
posts.title: Welcome II the Terrordome
posts.excerpt: The first feature ever directed by a black British woman is this ferocious, ambitious, dystopian nightmare influenced by African mythology, the films of Spike Lee, and the music of Public Enemy. A near-future inner-city ghetto implodes under the pressure of racial tensions, poverty, and police brutality, in “a world which doesn’t breathe so much as …

posts._title: Mauritz Stiller – Balettprimadonnan AKA Anjala the Dancer (1916)
posts.title: Balettprimadonnan
posts.excerpt: The musician Wolo is in love with the beautiful peasant girl Anjuta. She is forced, by her stepmother who runs a speakeasy, to dance for the drunken guests of the tavern. Restored by The Swedish Film Institute in 2016. Quote:A first preservation of Mauritz Stiller’s Balettprimadonnan was carried out in 1994, from a fragment of …

posts._title: Luchino Visconti – Lo straniero aka The Stranger (1967)
posts.title: Lo straniero
posts.excerpt: IMDB:A man faces a trial for murder. The court is biased because of his personal qualities.

posts._title: Bakhtyar Khudojnazarov – Kosh ba kosh AKA Odds and Evens (1993)
posts.title: Kosh ba kosh
posts.excerpt: Quote:The film tells a romantic love story set against the background of Tajik Civil War (1992-1996.) Curfews and bursts of tracer bullets piercing the night hardly seem compatible with a love story. In this strange and dangerous time the men of the city are all into gambling. Everybody gambles with everybody. The situation reaches absurd …

posts._title: Archie Mayo – It’s Love I’m After (1937)
posts.title: It’s Love I’m After
posts.excerpt: An actor of the stage finds himself pursued by a lovestruck fan while trying to patch up a tempestuous relationship with his actress lover.

posts._title: Michael Powell & Emeric Pressburger – ‘I Know Where I’m Going!’ (1945)
posts.title: ‘I Know Where I’m Going!’
posts.excerpt: Quote:A young Englishwoman goes to the Hebrides to marry her older, wealthier fiancé. When the weather keeps them separated on different islands, she begins to have second thoughts.

posts._title: Atiq Rahimi – Syngué sabour, pierre de patience AKA The Patience Stone (2012)
posts.title: Syngué sabour, pierre de patience
posts.excerpt: Quote:In a war ridden country a woman watches over the husband reduced to a vegetable state by a bullet in the neck, abandoned by Jihad companions and brothers. One day, the woman decides to say things to him she could never have done before.

posts.title: 100 Vaginas
posts.excerpt: A bold, feminist film about how the vagina has shaped our view of the world and the shame around female sexuality. Women from 19 to 77 years old talk about puberty, menstruation, birth, motherhood, infertility, menopause, pleasure, sex, pain, trauma, gender, sexuality, cancer, rape and FGM.

posts.title: Passing Through
posts.excerpt: Quote:Eddie Warmack, an African American jazz musician, is released from prison for the killing of a white gangster. Not willing to play for the mobsters who control the music industry, including clubs and recording studios, Warmack searches for his mentor and grandfather, the legendary jazz musician Poppa Harris. Director Larry Clark theorizes that jazz is …
